Share with bl.ocks.org

2018-08-20

Source: vignettes/blocks.Rmd
blocks.Rmd

Mike Bostock’s blocks service is a great resource for sharing visualizations. Blocks (as they are called) are not stored at this website, they are taken from GitHub gists. If you have the gistr and fs packages installed, and have a GitHub account (PAT), you can deploy a vegaspec to gist, and it will appear as a block. If you have the magick and webdriver packages (with PhantomJS installed), you can include preview and thumb images with the block. If a block (not necessarily yours) has a vegaspec, and the spec is in its own file, you can import a vegaspec from a block.

TODO: Include caveats about git2r.

Create a block

library("vegawidget")
vw_create_block(spec_mtcars)
## block url: https://bl.ocks.org/06a512525fbe7a96e1a2028e1871b61c
##  gist url: https://gist.github.com/06a512525fbe7a96e1a2028e1871b61c
gistid <- vw_create_block_gistid(spec_mtcars)
## block url: https://bl.ocks.org/650e59f6a81cf63b9004ae291fe90667
##  gist url: https://gist.github.com/650e59f6a81cf63b9004ae291fe90667

Retrieve a block

vw_retrieve_block(gistid$id)
## retrieving `spec.json` from gist 650e59f6a81cf63b9004ae291fe90667
